page.title: 01Newbiggin Bay
page.content: Newbiggin Point with the church as a landdmark, has been an important point for shipping since medieval times when Newbiggin was a town.Even in the early nineteenth century there was a harbour at the mouth of the Wansbeck. Grain aad grindstones were exported as well as coal. The Wansbeck ws much used by fishing boats but recently the barier put across the river for the marina hs caused the restriction of crossing the baar to 2 hours only on high tide. So there are now more rod fishermen. A very common activity is the recoveryy of sea coal in large quantities after the tide has fallen. Heavy seas have caused much damage at Newbiggin and new defences have been necessary. The area has very high scenic value and providdes for a variety of leisure activity including
